review.title: Maximizing positive opinion influence using an evidential approach
review.abstract: In this paper, we propose a new data based model for influence maximization in online social networks. We use the theory of belief functions to overcome the data imperfection problem. Besides, the proposed model searches to detect influencer users that adopt a positive opinion about the product, the idea, etc, to be propagated. Moreover, we present some experiments to show the performance of our model.

metadata.title: MAXIMIZING POSITIVE OPINION INFLUENCE USING AN EVIDENTIAL APPROACH

sections.heading: 1 Introduction
sections.text: The phenomena of influence spreading through social networks have attracted a large body of research. A key function of an online social network (OSN), in addition to sharing, is that it allows users to express their personal opinions about a product or a trend of messages through posts, likes / dislikes, etc. However, such opinions are passed on to other users and could have a significant impact on them. The real world is full of inaccuracy and uncertainty and this fact inevitably affects the OSN data. In fact, social interactions cannot always be precise and secure, even OSN only allows limited access to their data, which creates more inaccuracy and uncertainty. Then, if we ignore this imperfection, we are confronted with erroneous analytical results.

sections.heading: 3 Experiments
sections.text: In this section, we conduct some experiments with real data. We used the Twitter4j2 library, which is a Java implementation of the Twitter API, to collect Twitter data. We combed the Twitter network for the period between 2http: / / twitter4j.org / en / index.html08 / 09 / 2014 and 03 / 11 / 2014, and we filtered our data by only keeping tweets that talk about smartphones and users who have at least one tweet in the database. To estimate the opinion polarity of each tweet in our dataset, we first used the Java library "Stanford POS Tagger" 3 with the model "GATE Twitter Part-of-Speech Tagger" 4 designed for tweets. This step gives a tag (verb, noun, etc.) to each word in the tweet. After estimating the opinion polarity of each tweet, we use the WordNet step 3.05 dictionary and tags from the first one.

sections.heading: 4 Conclusion
sections.text: In this article, we have proposed a new parameter of influence that assesses the positive influence of OSN users. In future work, we will try to improve the proposed model of influence maximization by taking into account other parameters such as user profile and propagation time.
